intro: Sparganium erectum subsp. polyedrum, commonly known as the spiked bur reed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Typhaceae. It is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems that are often covered in spiky, reddish-brown bracts. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and along the edges of ponds and lakes. Its unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an important component of aquatic and wetland ecosystems.
